intro: Hedyotis st-johnii, commonly known as St. John's wort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. It is a low-growing herb with slender stems and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Hedyotis st-johnii is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other medicinal and ornamental plants.
